location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.607 of 1856 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, relating to the slave trade between East Africa and the Gulf. Enclosed with the letter is an extract of paragraph 19 of despatch no.30 of 1855 (folio 186), from the Court of Directors, dated 19 December 1855, stating that Captain Kemball [the previous Persian Gulf Resident] does not believe the assurances of the Shaikh of Sharjah, Sultan bin Suggur [Sultan bin Saqr], that his subjects will not proceed to the ports of East Africa this season.
